pullRequest.title: Rework Settings Page UI
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist


 the contributor license agreement is signed
 commit message follows commit guidelines
 tests are included
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes

Description of change

#1337
Based upon meetings in the Edalex team, this has been redesigned visually. The SettingsList and SettingsListControl components were also made for reuse in the future.
Jest tests as well as TestNG tests (SearchSettingsTest) should still work with these changes.

commit.message: Rework checkbox component into swtich component
Add new SettingsList and SettingsListControl components
Put helperText at the bottom of the SearchSettingFormControl
Rework page to use the new SettingsList components and SaveButton

nodes.bodyText: It may be worth commenting somewhere why we're not using the helperText property that's available in some of the MUI control components (e.g. TextField), this will become important when validation comes in and it's impact to components like this (if this is used for anything that gets validated in the future).   If a control comes in here with helperText then this may get confusing.
Odd to dictate where a component should be placed, this component doesn't care.
JS doc params should start with @param, no need for :
Import isn't needed, it can be React.ReactNode or a named import on the react import line
Lot of magical numbers, this looks like something devs will tweak back and forth.  I'm not sure of an alternative.

Should the save button and MessageInfo be outside the card?
Will the success snackbar be a standard? If so will it be put on every page or moved a level up?

This is a repeating standard pattern, a component could be added SettingsListToggleControl.  It may not reduce the lines of code on the page but will standardise the toggles or allow for them to flip between checkboxes or toggles without the pages needed to be updated in multiple places

Looks like a candidate for either Grids or a container element around the cards that does this rather than every single card.
Looking at the page, it looks like there are two columns (cards on the left, save button on the right) but the page is structured with styling of the contents rather than having columns that the contents fill.
Not recommending this now but if this becomes the standard (Card with the first child being SettingsList) then they could be combined (e.g. SettingsListCard).
If this becomes the standard then it should be a dedicated component, allows rapid re-use and reduce boilerplate on the pages.
Does oEQ have any issues with tree shaking?  I had an issue using the named imports bringing all of the icons into the bundled JS but switching to default imports fixed it.
This screams magical number, the ListItem container is flexing so the ListItemText could be styled (think it's flex-basis but would need to experiment)
Is the event ever needed by the consumer?  if not the just the checked can be emitted
Can control be undefined?  If it is then does the ListItemSecondaryAction need to be rendered with nothing?

It doesn't look like anything except divider should be undefined, being undefinable may make the component flexible but it doesn't look like it needs to be flexible.
If they're undefined then it raises questions about what it looks like with different things being undefined, e.g. storybook stories, tests, etc...

commit.message: Move Button and Snackbar outside of the card
Stop allowing undefined text and controls in SettingsListControl.tsx

nodes.bodyText: I am just curious if there are scenarios in which multiple controls are needed in a ListItemSecondaryAction.
